Container¶

implement functions to build, start, stop and clean up containers

class prestest.container.Container(docker_folder: Union[pathlib.PosixPath, str])[source]¶

Bases: object

contains method to control and examine hive/presto container used for test

append_file(container_name, file, text, skip_if_exists=True, user='root', from_new_line=True)[source]¶

append a line to target file in target container_name. You can choose to skip (by default) if the text already exists in target file. you may change user in the docker by specifying user. If from_new_line is True, the text will always be appended in a new line. otherwise directly appended at EOF.

Parameters

  • container_name – name of the container the target file is contained in.

  • file – target file in the container.

  • text – content to append.

  • skip_if_exists – if text already exists in file, do not append duplicate. the checking will strip white space.

  • user – user used to execute the operation. e.g. ‘root’, ‘1000’

  • from_new_line – if True, the text will always be appended from a new line.

Returns

None

copy_from_local(from_local: Union[pathlib.PosixPath, str], to_container: Union[pathlib.PosixPath, str], container_name: str = 'docker-hive_hive-server_1')[source]¶

copy folder or file from host to container

Parameters

  • from_local – target folder or file to be copied.

  • to_container – container path where the folder or file will be copied to.

  • container_name – name of the container containing the target file to_container

Returns

None

delete(target, container_name: str = 'docker-hive_hive-server_1')[source]¶

call rm -rf command on target inside datanode container

Parameters

  • target – target folder or file

  • container_name – name of the container containing the target file

Returns

None

download_from_container(from_container, to_local, container_name: str = 'docker-hive_hive-server_1')[source]¶

download target folder or file to host

Parameters

  • to_local – location on host.

  • container_name – name of the container containing the target file from_container

enable_table_modification()[source]¶

edit hive.properties file in presto connector server so that hive table can be modified in presto. note that this may fail if presto server version changes

Returns

None

execute_command(command, exception=<class 'RuntimeError'>)[source]¶

execute a command as subprocess, raise specific type of exception if any error occurs.

Parameters

  • command – a string of terminal command

  • exception – type of exception raised when any error happends.

Returns

None

is_healthy() → bool[source]¶

check if container is healthy. if exited containers are contained not healthy. if health condition is not configured, the container is considered healthy. A healthy container is read to take request such as presto queries.

Returns

whether container is healthy or not.

is_presto_started() → bool[source]¶

examine if presto server has properly started. This will try 5 times before determining that the server cannot be connected. It will sleep 5 seconds between retries.

Returns

whether presto server is started.

is_started() → bool[source]¶

check if container has properly started.

Returns

reset(allow_table_modification=False, autostart=False, until_started=False)[source]¶

remove created container. This will clear all data and metastore and restore the container to factory state.

Parameters

  • allow_table_modification – reset and allow presto connector to modify hive tables

  • autostart – restart container after reset

  • until_started – wait until completed restarted. if True, container will be force autostarted.

Returns

None

start(until_started=True)[source]¶

start docker containers.

Returns

None

stop()[source]¶

stop containers

Returns

upload_temp_table_file(local_file, container_name: str = 'docker-hive_hive-server_1')[source]¶

return a context manager to upload the file to a temp file in container. See TempContainerFile for details

Example

>>> with self.upload_temp_table_file('local_file', 'target_container') as f:
...     # do something with f where f is the temporary file name in the container.
class prestest.container.TempContainerFile(container: prestest.container.Container, local_file: Union[pathlib.PosixPath, str], container_name: str = 'docker-hive_hive-server_1')[source]¶

Bases: object

a context manager class used to upload file to temporary file in target container. You need to pass a Container object and target container_name. The temporary file will be removed at exit. Note that the temporary file in target container will have the same permission as local_file.
